security: This document details the CIA's relationship with Charles William Wiley, including his recruitment, activities, and payments. Disclosing these details could expose operational methods, compromise sources, and reveal financial arrangements with covert associates. Specifically, the document mentions: 'It was made clear to Wiley that CIA was purchasing the end product of his work and that he was not now a CIA employee.' Revealing the covert use of Wiley could damage the CIA's reputation and compromise future operations.
summary: A summary report prepared by CIA Cover Employee Louis W. Vasaly and John P. Dempsey covering Charles William Wiley's background, recruitment, activities, and termination with the CIA, based on existing documents in the Office of Security files.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated April 1, 1974, from John P. Dempsey, Chief of the Research Branch, to the Deputy Director of Security, provides a summary report on Charles William Wiley prepared by Louis W. Vasaly and Dempsey. The report covers Wiley's background, recruitment, security processing, activities from 1956 to 1974, contractual relationship with the CIA, overseas travel, utilization, cover, personal activity, termination, and contacts with individuals such as James McCord, Lee Pennington, Donald Sweany, and Howard Hunt, and is based on documents found in the Office of Security files.
title: Wiley, Charles William
